agency_name: AREA FIVE AGENCY ON AGING AND COMMUNITY SERVICES
agency_desc: An Indiana Area Agency on Aging providing programs and services that benefit low income, disadvantaged, and older persons living in Cass, Fulton, Howard, Miami, Tipton, and Wabash Counties.
site_name: AREA FIVE AGENCY ON AGING AND COMMUNITY SERVICES - TIPTON COUNTY
service_description: Provides support groups, information, and referrals for grandparents who are raising their grandchildren. Child care is available during the meeting. Transportation is provided when available and within city limits.
taxonomy_name: Adoption and Foster/Kinship Care Support Groups
nameLevel5: Adoption and Foster/Kinship Care Support Groups
site_details: Call to confirm location(s), dates, and times.

site_schedule.name: Adoption and Foster/Kinship Care Support Groups

site_eligibility: Raising a grandchild, family member's child, or someone else's child

agency_desc: A nonprofit family resource center that provides a wide variety of social services that are designed to support the healthy development of families with information and access to the resources they need to be connected and safe.
service_description: Provides monthly laundry vouchers to people. Detergent and quarters for washers and dryers are provided.
site_details: Call more information on location and date of laundry vouchers.
site_eligibility: Living in Tipton County

agency_name: AREA FIVE AGENCY ON AGING AND COMMUNITY SERVICES - SENIOR NUTRITION PROGRAM
agency_desc: An Indiana Area Agency on Aging (Area Five), providing services to seniors in Cass, Fulton, Howard, Miami, Tipton, and Wabash County.
site_name: AREA FIVE CONGREGATE MEALS - TIPTON SENIOR CENTER
service_description: Provides nutritious, sit-down lunch and fellowship for area seniors. Reservations required at least 24 hours in advance. A donation is requested.
site_details: Call at least 24 hours in advance for reservations.
site_eligibility: Age 60 or older

agency_desc: An incorporated nonprofit agency which "strives to eradicate domestic and sexual violence through education, prevention, and intervention in Central Indiana." Alternatives Inc. supports survivors through the initial crisis with the ultimate strategy of helping them achieve abuse-free and financially independent lives.
service_description: Provides assistance and crisis response to survivors of domestic violence, sexual assault, and human trafficking. Services include court accompaniment, assistance filing a protective order, advocacy, and case management. Can assist with arranging emergency transportation from Tipton County to the shelter in Anderson for survivors and their dependents who have been accepted into the shelter.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: For immediate assistance call the crisis hotline. For all other inquiries call, email, visit website, or Facebook page for assistance. www.alternativesdv.org / www.facebook.com/AlternativesIncDV
site_eligibility: Survivors of domestic violence, sexual assault, or human trafficking with or without dependents living or working in Tipton County

agency_desc: Our mission is to strengthen our communities and to improve the health and well-being of those we are privileged to serve. We use evidence based practices that treat the whole person. Our team of board-certified psychiatrists and psychologists, highly trained and certified therapists, nurses, and case workers deliver comprehensive care and treatment for mental health conditions.
service_description: Provides assessment and outpatient counseling and treatment for people with substance use issues and their families. Also includes intensive outpatient services and drug screenings.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.

agency_desc: A community center offering social and recreational activities for seniors,  and transportation services for people in need living in Tipton County and the surrounding areas.
service_description: Provides on-demand public transportation for Tipton County and the surrounding areas. Transportation is also available for people who are traveling to a medical appointment within Tipton County. Reservations required. Vehicles are wheelchair accessible.

Open -- Age 60 and older

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides inspections, permits, code enforcement, and other services to protect the health and safety of Tipton County residents. Regulates drainage and septic systems, public swimming pools, and food service establishments in the county. Investigates reports of sanitation violations, substandard housing conditions, air or water pollution, and safety hazards posed by vacant buildings. Offers information and referrals regarding household health and environmental hazards, such as mold, lead, radon, tap water contamination, mosquitoes, and rodents.
site_details: Call for information, to request services, or to make a report.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; Open
Births/deaths occurring in the County -- Individual named on the birth certificate, parent, or other adult with a legal right to the certificate
Open -- Age 6 months and older
Varies by service; call for details.
Age 19 or older -- Open

Open -- Testing is recommended for any child 6 months through 6 years old who: Lives in or visits a building constructed before 1978 -Or- lives with someone who works with lead (such as a battery factory, steel smelter, stained glass) -OR- has a sibling or playmate who has been diagnosed with lead poisoning.
Open
Schools, community organizations, and other groups in the County

Open -- Age 2 months through 18 years -- Without health insurance -OR- insurance does not cover needed vaccine (including coverage that has capped out) -OR- insured through Medicaid -OR- American Indian or Alaskan Native, regardless of insurance status

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties for the city of Tipton in Tipton County.
service_description: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties for the city of Tipton in Tipton County. Persons in need of emergency police assistance should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency assistance. For nonemergency services, call the office during business hours or call Tipton County dispatch after hours.

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides a full-service hospital.
service_description: Offers a full-service hospital providing a wide range of diagnostic, treatment, and health care programs, including 24-hour emergency care.

agency_desc: Serves as the executive and administrative authority for Tipton County.
service_description: Serves as the executive and administrative authority fortheir respectivecounty, including performing the following duties:controls, maintains, and supervises county property; audits and authorizes claims against the county; receives bids for and authorizes county contracts; performs certain election functions; handlesappealof township trustee decisions.

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services.
service_description: Serves as a court for city ordinance violations and some misdemeanors in the city of Tipton in Tipton County. Hears traffic violation cases and provides information about traffic and parking tickets issued within the city of Tipton in Tipton County.

agency_desc: Represents the state of Indiana in felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions, conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic violations, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
service_description: Represents the state of Indiana in all felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions resulting from crimes committed in Tipton County. The prosecutor's office also conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic laws, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.

agency_desc: Government agency that locates, identifies, and appraises all taxable property in Tipton County.
service_description: Calculates the value of all taxable property in Tipton County, which is then used to assess taxes. Hears appeals of assessments, oversees reassessments, and maintains information on boundaries and ownership.
site_details: Call or walk in for information.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; limited to taxable property

agency_desc: County veterans service officers are veterans employed by the county to act as liaisons with county residents for veteran issues, including but not limited to; providing forms, information, and assistance in obtaining state and federal veterans benefits.
service_description: Provides information about and assistance with veterans' benefits to veterans, their surviving spouses, and their children. County service officers can assist in the completion and submission of forms necessary to receive all appropriate federal and state veterans' benefits.
site_details: Call, walk in, or send an email for assistance.
site_eligibility: Veteran, surviving spouses or children of a veteran.

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Handles civil lawsuits for $6,000 or less, including contracts, collection of rent, evictions, and personal loans. Only corporations are required to be represented by an attorney and only on claims over $1,500. In Tipton County, Circuit Court handles small claims cases.
site_details: Call or walk in for information.

site_schedule.name: Probation
site_schedule.schedule: Mon, Tues, Thurs, and Fri 8am-noon and 1pm-4pm; Wed 8am-noon

site_schedule.schedule: Mon, Tues, Thurs, and Fri 8am-noon and 1pm-4pm; Wed 8am-noon

site_eligibility: To file a lawsuit: Age 18 or older -- With a civil claim for less than $6,000 -- Meeting one of the following three requirements: Person being sued lives or works in Tipton County- Matter resulting in lawsuit took place in Tipton County- Matter resulting in lawsuit was to be performed in Tipton County
Offenders assigned to probation by the Tipton County Court
Persons named in cases or called for jury duty at this court

agency_desc: Provides maintenance services on public roads and streets.
service_description: Maintains county roadways in Tipton County, including patching, paving, snow removal, street sweeping, roadside mowing, and drainage along roadways. Offers sandbags to Tipton County households for use during times of flooding.

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities; administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration; issues marriage licenses; and records state tax liens.
service_description: Issues, provides, and maintains marriage licenses issued in the county. No witnesses, blood tests, or waiting period are required to obtain one. Both applicants must appear at the time of application. Marriages must take place within 60 days of the marriage license being issued.
taxonomy_name: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices
nameLevel4: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices
site_details: Walk in. Marriage license forms may be completed in advance online or in the clerk's office.

Parents ordered by the court to pay or receive child support

Registering to vote: United States citizen -- Age 18 by the day of the next election -- Not currently incarcerated -- To vote: Registered to vote a minimum of 29 days before the election
